intro: Heylandia cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf daphne, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features elliptical, heart-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its showy, fragrant flowers are typically pink or white and bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal and sandy soils.
